text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Nishan a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Hyderabad India today I am going to show
you how to turn on logging for your
Amazon Cloud fund distribution and then
how to choose between standard logging
and real-time login let's get started
cloudfront provides us multiple ways to
log the requests that come to cloudfront
distribution you can choose either
standard logging or real-time login
s provide detailed records about every
request that's made to a distribution
these logs are useful for many scenarios
including security and access audits
you can have these logs delivered to the
Amazon simple storage service bucket of
your choice cloudfront doesn't charge
for the standard logs so you anchor
Amazon S3 charges for storing and
accessing the log files
cloudfront real-time logs provide
information about request made to a
distribution in real time you can choose
the sampling rate of your real-time logs
that is the percentage of request that
you want to receive real-time log
records for you can also choose the
specific fields that you want to receive
in the log records
these logs are delivered to the data
stream of your choice in Amazon can you
search data streams
cloudfront charges for real-time logs in
addition to the charges that you incur
for using Genesis data streams
now let's look at how to turn on
cloudfront standard logs
from the AWS Management console navigate
to the cloudfront console
on the cloudfront console choose the
distribution that you want to update on
the general tab under setting choose
edit
for standard login select on
now let's choose the S3 bucket where
we've gone cloudfront to deliver the log
files
you can also specify an optional prefix
for the file names
to turn on optional cookie login select
on if the setting is turned on then
cloudfront logs the cookies in all
requests regardless of the cookies that
you choose to forward to the origin
choose save changes now let's look at
how to turn on cloudfront real-time
blocks on the cloudfront console from
the left hand navigation select logs
choose the real-time configuration stamp
choose create configuration
for sampling rate enter the percentage
of request that you want to receive
real-time log records for
for Fields choose the specific fields
that you want to receive in the log
records
in the choose option drop down list
select any field that you want to
include in the configuration
choose one or more Kinesis data streams
to receive real-time logs
for IM role choose either the create new
service role option which creates the
AWS identity and access management role
or choose an existing IEM role
note that when you select the option for
create new service role you must have
the permissions to create IM rows
in the distribution section choose a
cloudfront distribution and cache
Behavior to attach to the real time log
configuration please note that this
setting is optional when configuring
real-time logs
now choose create configuration
so now you know how to turn on login for
your Cloud Trend distribution using
standard and real-time logs
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
foreign
[Music]
